data.value: T_Optionally, a tag mask to filter by. T_This can consist of any number of tag searches - each term can be separated by a semi-colon and they are all applied to the search (ie. they are AND'ed terms not OR'ed terms). T_For example, "Account: T_Joint; -Balance: T_Overdrawn; Card: T_*Visa*" will include any items which match all the terms, ie. every item must have an 'Account: T_Joint' tag applied, no item can have a 'Balance: T_Overdrawn' tag applied, every item must have a tag applied which starts with 'Card: ' T_and then contains the text 'Visa'.

T_If a process encounters an exception, this information can be used to skip to the parts of the process not yet done for the item next time it is worked. T_The item must be 'owned' by the calling process - i.e. it must have been retrieved using Get Next Item.
T_This action will also reset the Attempts column to zero, because if the status updated the process should have successfully done something.

data.name: clsWorkQueuesActions_GetNextItemAction_OptionallyATagMaskToFilterByThisCanConsistOfAnyNumberOfTagSearchesEachTermCanBe
data.value: T_Optionally, a tag mask to filter by. T_This can consist of any number of tag searches - each term can be separated by a semi-colon and they are all applied to the search (ie. they are AND'ed terms not OR'ed terms). T_For example, "Account: T_Joint; -Balance: T_Overdrawn; Card: T_*Visa*" will include any items which match all the terms, ie. every item must have an 'Account: T_Joint' tag applied, no item can have a 'Balance: T_Overdrawn' tag applied, every item must have a tag applied which starts with 'Card: ' T_and then contains the text 'Visa'.

data.name: clsWorkQueuesActions_GetNextItemAction_OptionallyAKeyValueToFilterByOnlyItemsWithThisKeyValueWillBeConsidered
data.value: T_Optionally, a key value to filter by. T_Only items with this key value will be considered.

data.name: clsWorkQueuesActions_GetNextItemAction_TheNameOfTheQueue
data.value: T_The name of the queue

data.name: clsWorkQueuesActions_GetNextItemAction_ThisActionGetsTheNextItemToBeWorkedFromTheQueueReturningItsDetailsAndLockingItS
data.value:
T_This action gets the next item to be worked from the queue, returning its details and locking it so no other case can work it.
T_Items with higher priorities (lower numerical value) are processed first. T_Where the priority is the same, the next item is the one that has been in the queue the longest, is not already locked, and is not already completed.
T_The Item ID returned is used to make further calls to update the work status for that item. T_It may be empty, in which case there are no items available. T_This can mean either a) the queue is empty, or b) the queue is not running. T_This mechanism can be used to cleanly stop all processes working a particular queue at the end of the next case. T_Items that have a 'deferred' time set will not be returned unless that time has been reached.
